Test Name: Neisseria gonorrhoeae Nucleic Acid Amplification Test (NAAT)
Specimen Type: First-catch urine; urethral, endocervical, rectal, oropharyngeal, and vaginal swabs
Purpose: To detect and amplify Neisseria gonorrhoeae nucleic acids in clinical specimens for the diagnosis of gonorrhea.
Container: Sterile urine collection cup or manufacturer-approved swab transport tube suitable for NAAT
Equipment: NAAT instrument (e.g., Cepheid GeneXpert, Hologic Panther, Roche Cobas 4800) with Neisseria gonorrhoeae reagent kits; microcentrifuge; vortex mixer; pipettes
